reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My fiance and I have stayed in a few places in New Hampshire and never felt so comfortalble and at home before. The acommodations were more than we pictured and we had seen the pictures. It was very clean and neat. The bed was oh so comfortable it was hard to get out of bed in the morning, but knowing there was a delicious breakfast being offered we got up. You got to try Rod's waffles! The area was quiet but just close enough to do what ever you chose for the day. Two great pools on the premises and a hot tub, you didn't have to go far to relax.
reviews.title: We didn't want to come home, it felt like home.

reviews.text: But most of all the owners Rod and Linea are the nicest genuine people you will ever meet. We cannot say how nice they really were. You'll just have to go and experience the Old Field House yourself, you will not find a more comfortable place besides your own home. If you do go and you are a dog lover you will meet Teddy and she is the most beautiful, wonderful dog you will ever meet. A great dog belonging to a great family.
reviews.title: Best Family Inn in the area

reviews.text: We have stayed at the Old Field House Inn now 3 years in a row in adjoining rooms and are going back July 2009. Our children LOVE it. We always stay on the lower level in romos 102 and 103. Each room has their own bathroom which is great fro a family of 5. The room the children stay in has bunk beds with a double on the bottom and a twin on the top. GREAT for a family with 3 children. The other room has a queen bed and perfect for the adults. The rooms are huge but big enough to sleep in. We have stayed at several other places in the area and nothing can compare. The kids love the pool and the game room. Oh and how can I forget the movie room they think this is the best part of all. The Inn keepers make you feel like you are home. Thank you for a great stay and we will see you soon!!!!
reviews.title: feels like our own personal vacation home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have stayed at the Old Field House several times since discovering the beautiful, quaint and yet, pajama-friendly Inn. The private and common rooms, breakfast area, movie room, jacuzzi, etc. are all perfect. The breakfast (included) offers so many choices and is so fresh, it is reason enough to stay here! My teenage son and preteen son and daughter refer to the Old Field House as "our vacation house". Linea and Rod are the best hosts we've met in 20+ years of travelling around New England. And, they evan have a great dog, Teddy!
reviews.title: great country inn with extreme hospitality

likes.liked: — The owners of this beautiful lodge are great hosts who create a very warm and friendly atmosphere without compromising privacy
likes.disliked: — Not one thing. It was a very pleasant stay and we will be back for sure.

reviews.title: WE love the Old Field House
reviews.text: The Old Field House owners, Linea and Rod and their staff are very gracious, friendly and accomodating. We recently stayed in a beautiful condo unit with a fireplace and jacuzzi. The unit was beautiful and clean. It was also private and very nicely decorated. The price is very reasonable for the accomodations that we had and it is located just a short distance from North Conway in the most ideal location one could imagine. Breakfast was included and it was delicious. The dining area is very clean and quaint with huge skylight windows and a very cozy atmosphere. The coffee is great and there is a big selection of cereals, pastries, muffins, oatmeal, and other breakfast delectables. The best was the waffles that Rod made for each guest upon order. The owners are so nice. They treat their guests as if they are all good friends. Very friendly and comfortable treatment by all.

The last time we visited Storyland, we stayed at The Suisse Chalet motor lodge and had a horrible time there. So, when a friend told me about this "Bed and Breakfast," I thought I would try it out. I am not a fan of B&Bs but I booked a room anyway. It was wonderful! My only regret is that I did not book more than one night. The room was quaint, warm and inviting. I felt at home. They even set up a pack and play for my 10 month old and the owners made our stay relaxing and enjoyable. And it definitely caters to families including a heated pool and a game room. This is one place my family intends on staying at again and again! LOVED IT!!!
reviews.title: My family loved it!

likes.liked: — The friendly service and quaint accommodations

reviews.text: We just returned from staying at the Old Field House. My wife and I stayed there twice before our daughter was born. We liked it so much the first two times we stayed, we went back as a family over the Memorial Day Weekend. We stayed in the "Honeymoon Suite". This suite has a full kitchenette, a seperate entrance, a jacuzzi tub, a pull out sofa bed, king sized bed, and cable serviced television. The room cost us $195 per night and we had plenty of room for our daughter's play yard by the pull out sofa. The Old Field House has many rooms including 2 and 3 bedroom suites.The proprietors are wonderful people and provide a full breakfast each morning. The property is located in the perfect spot and is approximately a five minute drive to outlet shopping at Settlers Green; and, a 6 mile drive to Story Land. There are many family oriented restaurants, activities, and events aruond the Old Field House, and the rates are quite affordable. If you want to get away from the hustle and bustle of day to day life, the Old Field House is the place to go to. I know we cannot wait to get back. Check it out for your self. Their website is: www.oldfieldhouse.com
reviews.title: Such a wonderful place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed in a half-dozen B&Bs during our early October tour of New England. The Old Field House (whose name might be taken for a gymnasium, and is anything but) was the best of them all. The genial owners, the accommodations, the good breakfast were all pluses, but best of all was the locale. The Old Field House is in a quiet, wooded, park-like setting. The view from the breakfast room is spectacular. An excellent experience for us.
reviews.title: Beauty in New Hampshire

reviews.text: We made a last minute trip to new Hampshire with our two little ones, 3 and 5. We were looking for a place that was family friendly and close to Story land and the Old Field House was recommended to us. We were able to book one of the townhouses behind the main building with only a few days notice. The price was about middle of the road for what we were looking at and the townhouse was extremely spacious. it was listed as a two bedroom but could easily have slept more people with a daybed in a nook at the top of the stairs, a massive master bedroom closet where you could easily put a crib or a couple of sleeping bags and couches in the main room. It also had a bath and 1/2, a full kitchen, a dining table for 8 and very large living room. Everything was very clean and well maintained, well stocked with towels, extra pillows and blankets. There was also a selection of games and books in the main room, perfect for a rainy day. There was a fireplace available but you are expected to supply your own wood. There was a bit of confusion on check-in. The website and sign out front said breakfast was included in the price but on check-in we were told that the townhouses were not included in the breakfast plan, only the main building. But when we protested the manager quickly said to just come on up. And breakfast was good, their specialty is belgian waffles with all the fixings but they also had eggs, toasts, oatmeal, sweet breads and cereal. Overall, I highly recommend this as a great home base for exploring an area that is very kid-friendly and packed with things to do.
reviews.title: spacious family vacation
Home away from home
reviews.text: We've stayed at the Old Field House many times over the past several years, summer and winter as each season in the Mt. Washington Valley offers plenty to do. The inn is centrally located within the valley and so a good hub for all the recreation options from hiking and skiing to shopping. Never been dissapointed and as a veteran shopper of vacation lodging, I would definitely say that the Old Field House is a terrific value. Inn rooms are clean, comfortable, with all standard ammenities, cable TV, phone. One caveat - some of the rooms tend to be small , but they do offer the option of adjoining rooms and family suites for parents plus kids. One of the best features is the extra space for hanging out in the lower level, i.e., game room for kids with ping pong etc and adjacent den with TV, books, scrabble and other board games. The ground level has a sunny dining area for breakfast as well as another very pleasant sitting room with gas fireplace. During nice weather, there are a couple of hammocks on a shaded lawn. All these places and spaces within the building and grounds give multiple options for hanging out other than the usual confine of a hotel room. Also on the grounds is a basketball hoop, spacious lawns for the kids to run around, swim pool and jacuzzi. If your group is larger, there is yet another option - 2-3 bedroom townhomes. These condos have it all including laundry, but best is that they can be rented on a nightly basis, I think with 2 nite min. Often when I'm looking for condo rentals, it's weekly only. The Innkeepers, Rod and Linea could not be nicer - attentive, helpful and resourceful . We'll be back. Tip: if skiing ask at desk about discount coupons available for many mountains.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: How many innkeepers give you a big (and sincere) hug when you leave in the morning? That's the kind of place the Old Field House is-- and the kind of warm and friendly hosts that Linea and Rod are. My wife wanted to reawaken her child within and go on a Polar Express excursion, so i went along. By the end of the weekend-- thanks largely to the hospitality we experienced at thr Old Field House-- I was as enchanted as she was. Our accomodations were more than sufficient-- a large, souper-clean room, not the most modern, but with every comfort and convenience you could want (including free DVDS from the lending library downstairs). Breakfast was ample and fresh-- with many items locally grown or produced. But it is the first rate hospitality that differentiates this place from all others. We left feeling as though Linea and Rod had been our friends for years. To them, their guests are #1 arnd it does the heart good to deal with such genuinely nice people. We can't wait to go back here!
reviews.title: A Magical Polar Express Experience

reviews.text: I stayed with my five year old daughter at the inn for only one night. They were incredibly gracious and at my beck and call for anticipating my needs. I would love to go back and stay again. The breakfast served in the morning was incredibly good. I can't say enough. It was like going to grandma's house and she couldn't wait to see you. Storyland visitors this is the place to stay with your children. Incredibly close and quiet enough for them to unwind.
reviews.title: Innkeepers Who Are Fantastic!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I am very picky when it comes to vacations therefore I put a lot of time and effort into researching for the perfect place. I must say Old Field House was definitely a fabulous find! My boyfriend and I were the only people staying at the inn at the time, and we felt like we were at home the entire stay! The inn keeper, Rod, is absolutely amazing, friendly, and a fantastic breakfast cook! He was always available when needed and answered all of our questions, including giving us an entire paper full of local restaurants that offer fantastic food ( I purchased a boiled lobster for only $12.99!!). I am definitely coming back to Old Field House on my next vacation to the White mountains and staying in the suite, which was so comfortable and spacious! My only complaint was leaving!!
reviews.title: Felt like a second home!

reviews.text: On our first morning we also saw a baby black bear roaming the area...such a great sight!
reviews.title: Comfortable, friendly, and a good value near North Conway, NH

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My family has stayed at the Old Field House three times over the past three years, in Fall, Winter and Spring. Each time it has felt like visiting family, with all the perks, without the family hassles. The Inn is well equipped to handle families with children, and we've seen many couples there as well. The rooms we have stayed in have plenty of space and are very comfortable and clean. One of the basement rooms offers a separate bedroom for the kids which we enjoy very much. The full, buffet breakfasts are enormous, with homemade waffles available, along with cereal, oatmeal, great coffee, eggs, sausage, homemade bread, bagels... There is a basement game room, which my children rave about. There is typically a nightly G rated movie shown on a wide screen tv in its own movie room, which is great for the kids and doesn't disturb others. The heated pool and hot tub are clean and the pool area includes cabanas to get out of the sun. The owners are very friendly and available to chat, and it's also easy to keep to yourself if that's what you prefer. The inn is in a lovely area where it's nice to take a morning stroll. Located a few minutes from Story Land and North Conway, 20 minutes from Mt. Washington, and only 45 minutes from Santa's Village, this is a great get away for families.
reviews.title: Happy with the Old Field House Inn

reviews.text: Been traveling to this area twice a year (spring & fall) for the past 15+ years and have stayed in many other hotels and resorts over the years. This was our first time staying at The Old Field House. The Old Field House is located just north of the traffic heavy North Conway downtown area and just south of Jackson which is ideal. Our family really liked and enjoyed our stay. With every place they have their pro's and con's and here was our's based on our two night stay recently.
reviews.title: Ideal Location

reviews.text: Pro's: Price, Location, Quiet, Included breakfast which had Rod's famouse waffles which I would have to say are awesome, Fresh coffee always availble in the lobby area, Both owners Linea & Rod are very friendly and accomodating, Teddy their dog is wonderful and friendly, room was comfortable and overall clean, room had refrigerator and A/C, nice game room, small outside pool and hot tub. Plenty of parking.
reviews.title: Home away from home

reviews.text: Con's: Arrival we found a few long hairs in the shower, Toilet seat was the old type that was painted and paint was chipping off, Lower Level (basement) where game room and theater are was musty smelling more so the theater room than the game room, one other pet peeve is their credit card machine prints your whole credit card number on both copies of the receipts. Most machines x-out all but the last few numbers for security reasons.
reviews.title: Fabulous Inn, Great Breakfast, Completely Kid Friendly

reviews.text: Again overall really liked this place and would recommend anyone to stay here.
reviews.title: Can't wait to go back again

reviews.text: We stayed @ the Old Field House for our stop-off to Story Land and Santa's Village. Rod and Linea are just about the nicest people you'd ever meet. Our kids felt right at home here and even commented after a couple of days of StoryLand-ing "when are we going back home?" (to the inn, mind you!) My girls loved the gameroom and Rod and Linea's big pussycat Alaskan Malamute "Teddy" even more. Rooms were clean and neat and Rod's morning waffles are definitely something special! Looking forward to our trip back soon.
reviews.title: Old Field House is our New Hampshire Home
